title: 11. IRRI Agronomy Challenge: Assessing Biotic Influences at Maximum Tillering (16 February 2012)

subtasks: Collect data on animal pests (insects, snails, rats).
Use quadrat sampling for disease and insect assessment.
Employ sweep net for flying insect tally (e.g., green leaf hoppers).
Utilize tapping method with water and detergent for sucking insects (e.g., plant hoppers).
Record weed types and canopy height in three one-meter quadrats.
Monitor rat damage and implement controls to prevent further gaps.
Reassess crop in reproductive, grain filling, and mature stages.
